edu.uchsc.ccp.dmap
Class DMAPToken

java.lang.Object
  edu.uchsc.ccp.dmap.DMAPToken

public class DMAPToken
extends java.lang.Object

A DMAPToken is an input concept for the Parser. Simple tokens are text strings corresponding to words. However, in more complex situations a token may correspong to a Protege frame with some slots filled in.

For example, when DMAP is used in a UIMA environment it might be paired with a entity tagger. The tagged entity annotations could be used as DMAP input tokens with a ProtegeFrameItem corresponding to the type of entity recognized and a [name] slot bound to the specific name of the entity.

Author:
R. James Firby

getSource

public java.lang.Object getSource()
Get the 'source' of this token. This value is not interpreted by the OpenDMAP system but it is available to post-processing systems via the tokens that were used to recognize a Reference.

Returns:
The source object set for this token

setSource

public void setSource(java.lang.Object source)
Get the 'source' of this token. This value is not interpreted by the OpenDMAP system but it is available to post-processing systems via the tokens that were used to recognize a Reference.

Parameters:
source - The 'source' object to save with this token

cEnd - The character position of the end of the token

The token

newToken

public static DMAPToken newToken(Parser parser,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.util.Vector<java.lang.Object> slots,
                                 int cStart,
                                 int cEnd,
                                 java.lang.Object uniquifier)
Create a new DMAPToken for a Protege Frame and it's slot fillers.

The 'uniquifier' object can be any Java object that is not equal to the 'uniqufuer' object of any other token. It can also be null in most circumstances without causing a problem.

Parameters:
parser - The parser that will be using this token
name - The name of the Protege Frame that this token represents
slots - The slot/filler pairs corresponding to this frame and token.
cStart - The character position of the start of the token
cEnd - The character position of the end of the token
uniquifier - An object that makes this token unique from any other tokens that might cover the same characters.
Returns:
The token
